channel.title: Multiple Problems, 1 Thread!

item.title: Multiple Problems, 1 Thread!
item.dc:creator: @srhiro srhiro
item.description:
@srhiro wrote:

java skill for private servers.

I fixed problem 3, but the solution goes back to problem 1, when I level up I have it say it in the chat that you lvl and what lvl you are, and it says I am 17 attack, but my attack says 1 / 9.

what do you mean voids? what voids can I use?
you mean update(); under boolean process?

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Problems, 1 Thread!
item.dc:creator: @boomer216 boomer216
item.description:
@boomer216 wrote:

[quote=“srhiro, post:1, topic:75032”]Hello All,
I have a-few problems with my server, and if I could just fix these it would be ready for release. so any help is greatly appreciated.

my source: testscape
my java skill: ( 1 out of 10 ) 7

[size=12pt][b]Problem 1:[b][/size]
When you level up you’re stats come out looking awkward.
Screenshot:

is there any way to fix this so when you level it would actually say the right stat: eg - 30 / 30 not 35 / 30.

[size=12pt]Problem 2:[/size]
I used this tutorial: Linky
for aggressive npcs, and complied with no errors, then decided to add custom npcs so added this in:

case  101: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

case  102: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

case  103: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

for the goblins to attack, and ran server with still no errors, and yet the npcs do not attack.
any help solving this would be great.

[size=12pt]Problem 3:[/size]
I can’t get the windows to go away:
Windows:


I searched this: “congratulations”
and found this

case 0: // Attack levelup
            sendFrame164(6247);
	stillgfx(199, absX, absY);
            sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248);
            sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249);
            sendMessage("Congratulations, your attack is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .");
            NpcDialogueSend = false;
            break;

and changed it to this:

case 0: // Attack levelup
            //sendFrame164(6247);
	//		stillgfx(199, absX, absY);
           // sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248);
           // sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249);
            sendMessage("Congratulations, your attack is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .");
            NpcDialogueSend = false;
            break;

but the window still comes up, but now the level up the player the stat went up, is 00, so how do I make the window go away completly on level up?

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thanks for reading this, and if you have a solution to one of my problems could you please post it like this?:

problem1: 
you should....
problem2: 
you should...
problem3:
you should...

you don’t have to but it would make things alot more organized if you did.

:D[/quote]

Lol java skills 7/10 and you can’t even figure this stuff out. Dude I will take a quote from fr33sc4p3:
“Just because you can code a private server, doesn’t mean you can code java”
Java isn’t adding commands.

Problem 1:
Calling voids is your friend

Problem 2:
I don’t know Jorsa’s code too well.

Problem 3:
case 185 and removeAllWindows(); or whatever it is called.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Problems, 1 Thread!
item.dc:creator: @srhiro srhiro
item.description:
@srhiro wrote:

Hello All,
I have a-few problems with my server, and if I could just fix these it would be ready for release. so any help is greatly appreciated.

my source: testscape
my java skill: ( 1 out of 10 ) 7

[size=12pt][b]Problem 1:[b][/size]
When you level up you’re stats come out looking awkward.
Screenshot:

is there any way to fix this so when you level it would actually say the right stat: eg - 30 / 30 not 35 / 30.

[size=12pt]Problem 2:[/size]
I used this tutorial: Linky
for aggressive npcs, and complied with no errors, then decided to add custom npcs so added this in:

case  101: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

case  102: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

case  103: // gob
	StartKilling = i;
break;

for the goblins to attack, and ran server with still no errors, and yet the npcs do not attack.
any help solving this would be great.

[size=12pt]Problem 3:[/size]
I can’t get the windows to go away:
Windows:


I searched this: “congratulations”
and found this

case 0: // Attack levelup
            sendFrame164(6247);
	stillgfx(199, absX, absY);
            sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248);
            sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249);
            sendMessage("Congratulations, your attack is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .");

            sendMessage("Congratulations, your attack is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .");
            NpcDialogueSend = false;
            break;

but the window still comes up, but now the level up the player the stat went up, is 00, so how do I make the window go away completly on level up?

you should....

you should...

you should...
